content:
I do not like rankings. Academic Rankings Considered Harmful! clearly summarises ideas I believe in: “An academic decision is typically a multi-objective optimization problem, in which the objective function is highly personal. A unidimensional ranking provides a seductively easy objective function to optimize. Yet such decision making ignores the complex interplay between individual preferences and programs’ unique patterns of strengths and weaknesses. Decision making by ranking is decision making by lazy minds, I believe”.
I especially like its summary: “Academic rankings are harmful, I believe. We have a responsibility to better inform the public, by ceasing to play the ranking games and by providing the public with relevant information”.
summary: I do not like rankings. Decision making by ranking is decision making by lazy minds, I believe”.
